p: Finally, twelve of the 116 plants cited by our informants are also traded in the streets of the Kathmandu Valley for the preparation of popular medicinal remedies, being a valuable source of income for local people [ 72]: Acorus calamus, Asparagus racemosus, Bergenia ciliata, Cautleya spicata, Curcuma angustifolia, Osyris wightiana, Phyllanthus emblica, Rubus ellipticus, Stephania glandulifera, Terminalia bellirica, Tinospora sinensis, and Valeriana jatamansi.
